website_summaries.verdict: Dedicated electric lawn edger makes clean borders and digs trenches to create flower beds and other boundaries.
pros: 3-position blade depth adjustment offers flexibility in edging and trench depths
Cutting line indicator acts as a guide
Shaft adjusts to user's height preference
Cutting depth adjusts from 1 to 1.5 inches
cons: Oversize blade guard can be in the way during use
Handle is not as comfortable or adjustable as some users would like

website_summaries.verdict: We were pleasantly surprised at the power of this compact model, which can cut through thicker than normal growth and includes an adjustable-height handle to accommodate all users.
pros: Users report that this model can handle even the thick grasses of the southern US, while leaving behind a clean edge
Includes an adjustable handle that can easily be raised or lowered based on a user's height
cons: While it works great on grass, this small model is not as good with dirt and debris, so creating the initial edge may be a bit of a chore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cut.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 8th or 10th try to get an edger able to do my property, and it had given me the best result so far. Forget line trimmers, all crap. Forget Stihl trimmers, the lines get blocked every 5 minutes forever... Forget black and decker, it gave me a good result, but imploded after one season. This one is doing a superb job at edging my lawn, i am getting a professional result, with very little effort. Now if it could last 4-5 years, it would be the perfect tool...
customer_reviews.author: Nkap

customer_reviews.title: Works just okay, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected but handle could have been made more adjustable to help keep the unit easier to hold against the sidewalk, want to walk away. The guard also needs to be adjustable, it holds itself up from the cut when it contacts the grass. Update on product, after fighting with it to edge the sidewalk, I figured out that the back part of the guard was too low and caused the unit to get stuck and also to get caught on the grass. I cut back the guard 2 inches and now the unit works as expected, see photo.
customer_reviews.author: 80omni

customer_reviews.title: It WORX!
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. The first time you edge, it will take about twice as long as later, after you have opened up a little trench. For that first time, move it backwards and forwards as you go, cleaning off the debris every so often.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Larry

customer_reviews.title: Edger piece broke off first time use
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived yesterday and gave it a go today, the edger piece already broke off (see attached photo). Going to exchange it for another one hopefully it'll be better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cy C.

customer_reviews.title: this was pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This edger works very well. You'll need to tighten down the bolt from time to time, but that's about the only negative I could come up with. Electric may be a pain to some, but I'd rather stretch an extension cable than deal with fuel mixtures. Even the first time, this was pretty easy to use. I then did a touch up every 3 weeks or so, and that was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B. Kutzer

customer_reviews.title: 3 star tool with modifications that can become a 5 star tool
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this tool for almost a year now. I started off loving it but at that time my lawn was in a very poor condition. As my grass grew in thicker and higher. I spent more time fighting with the oversized profile of the guard to try to actually get the edger into the crack where I needed it to edge. Also as the grass gets thicker that guard catches on grass you’ve passed creating significant drag and difficulty with making a clean straight cut. I broke out my Dremel tool and brought the guard down to about half of its intended size as shown in the photograph attached. Now this thing really is a five star product.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Buy if you want a back/headache
customer_reviews.text: Darn thing had the blade get loose and fly out on the very first use. To tighten the blade takes an act of god. This is going back for good. The blade after even tightening just stops when it touches grass.
customer_reviews.author: Raj K

customer_reviews.title: Great Edger!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Black & Decker edger for years...this one beats B&D, hands down!!! Easy to assemble, easy to operate, makes nice, clean edges.
customer_reviews.author: Gothguy

customer_reviews.title: Electric Edger
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The motor is very strong. My wife was using it and had it set too deep. This edger handled it with no problems, so I know it would work well for making small trenches, too. The wheels make it much easier to use, for her, than my gas powered edger with one wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Grimjaw

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This edger was used to do the first edging on a recent re-sod of the yard with tough Argentine Bahia grass. It was needed to finish the job after my old Ryobi electric edger / trimmer combo quickly burned out trying to get through the tough grass sod. I am trying to get away from using gas tools and less-than efficient multi-use trimmers. The Worx edger was assembled in five minutes and went right to work handling the job without a problem. Subsequent edging touch ups will be a breeze with this tool. It is lightweight, yet rugged and should be more than enough to handle average suburban yard jobs.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Flames from plug
customer_reviews.text: On the second use of the edger, while edging my lawn, flames came from the plug. I was focusing on the edger and being careful not to get too close to the sidewalk, when my husband yelled at me to turn it off! If he hadn't warned me, I may have been burned. I will not buy this brand for any of my yard needs again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: get it
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy a 300 buck Echo from Home Depot but i did a lot of research and watched a lot of videos.. decided to give this edger a try... This edger is AWESOME. Very easy to use and super fast shipping.. i had major growth on the concrete and was a little concerned with the power of the electric edger cutting the thick grass... no problem!!!!! it’s got a guard that allows you to slide down and goes along the concrete letting you cut a strait professional looking yard! I would recommend that you buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It didn't ship in "working" mode, and the nut stripped when I tried to adjust the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions and started at the highest level. Smart move because I just had new sod put down and it was doing some major trimming. The next week moved it down one level, still took a little time because I had been just using a week walker for many years and never went down to the dirt. Every following week, piece of cake! Now I am done in just a few minutes. Dont have to go slow at all. Had to use a hose to clean it the first few time because of so much dirt. Now I just use my blower to clean it off.
customer_reviews.author: furlongscott

customer_reviews.title: Renter and Homeowner Necessity
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. Easy to assemble, easy to use. Sounds like a saw when in use. If you've never used one before on your lawn, you will still have to pull up some grass or weeds from between the cut and the sidewalk or wherever you're creating your edge. But after this, a yearly maintenance is all you need. I see no benefit to paying the extra money for a gasoline edger when this works so very well. What's amazing about having and using an edger, is you could have a literal yard of weeds, and having a clean cut edge will make it look amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer T

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: It felt very unstable, the blade would wobble around, even after tightening it as much as it would go. When it did work, it just made a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Brandee Adderley

customer_reviews.title: Failed after second use.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Craftsman edger for 20+ years. I had to replace it because the plastic housing disintegrated. Mechanically it was still sound. I mention this because the trenches were already dug around my garden beds. So, it was light duty work to keep the beds nicely edged. The first time I used it was just to make sure it worked so that I could get rid of the box. The second time I ran it, it died after 15 minutes of light use. Disappointing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Good edger
customer_reviews.text: Really like the Worx brand lawn care stuff. Bought this and then a leaf blower shortly after and they work well together. I find myself hitting the blade on the concrete a bit even with the guide down but not sure if that is common with all edgers. Works well with a forward then quick back motion to clear out the soil and clippings.
customer_reviews.author: Lason

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my Husband for Father's Day, he ended up being the one that grabbed the door when it was delivered so he wanted it right away of course...He didn't want to wait till Father's Day, I didn't really wanna make him wait either because I really wanted to see the yard being edged. Well, he pulls it out of the box and within seconds was using it, super easy self explanatory to use. It worked great, super easy, fast, and just overall did a perfect line. Our yard looks so much better! We did the entire front and back right away. Highly recommend this edger! Anyone can use it, light duty, does the job!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: Not good on uneven surfaces...
customer_reviews.text: While I expect this is a great tool for edging along sidewalks or paved paths, don't expect it to work well from less even surfaces....such as the lawn around your flower beds or garden. We spent a frustrating hour trying to get an even cut before stashing this thing in a far corner of the toolshed where it has languished ever since. Much of the blame goes to me for not having considered how the whirring blade would bounce around as the wheel moved up and down on the grass. We tried adjusting the depth gauge... but it invariably digs in too far or barely skims the surface as the wheel rolls over uneven grass.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Cowan

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I just edged my yard for the first time with this edger. Last season I paid someone to edge because I couldn't maneuver a weed eater. I'm pretty sure that I need a new blade already, but I have tough St. Augustine grass that was overtaking my sidewalk. It made a nice little trench and it was so easy! It also has an actual trenches, which I will use on other areas. I highly recommend this edger. I bought a 100 foot cord at Walmart and the three prong thingy fit into the circular area of the edger cord. I'm just so happy that I can do this myself!
customer_reviews.author: tkorbitz

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a disappointment. Bought this edger last fall in preparation for spring. Assembled correctly, followed instructions for use. Edged a lawn area seemingly without issue. Went to edge another lawn area and a plastic part snapped off rendering the edger useless!
customer_reviews.author: Jane B.

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful And Don't Force It!
customer_reviews.text: I really needed some edging help and this tool really helps! I ran into one issue where I was pushing it hard to cut into the overgrown grass and dirt on the edge of the sidewalk/lawn. The lower "guide" broke! :( This was my fault for what I would call "snow shoveling" the edger along the sidewalk. I tried to repair but couldn't. This guide blade folds up or can be removed. I glued it together and just leave it folded for now. Otherwise, this edger gets the job done. I just need to use some patience and take my time in use. Cleaning and disassembly is fairly straight forward. Blade replacement and/or sharpening should pretty easy for most DIY'ers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gutknecht

customer_reviews.title: Check the Amperage on Your Extension Cord!
customer_reviews.text: Works far better than the Black and Decker which this replaced. One caveat: this is a 12amp machine. If you use a standard outdoor extension cord it will likely blow out, of the edger will stop running. I had to buy a new cord and with this, it runs great.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Teufel

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to find replacement blade.
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately cannot give a good review. I should have listened to the advice of other reviewers and not used this guy to trim back severe overhang. That being said it did a good job (minus a loose bolt like others have mentioned) but now the blade is dead and for the life of me I cannot find a replacement blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Major Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers who raised concerns with the blade nut coming loose early and often are definitely worth paying attention to. On my first use, the nut came loose, after working fine for the first half hour. So, this makes “easy to use” a joke. This is a serious design flaw which could easily be resolved. Why, Worx, do you continue to dodge this fundamental—and dangerous—issue?
customer_reviews.author: Dolphin

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used only a few times so far. Goes through heavy St. Augustine grass like a wild hog. Cuts cleanly. Negatives: Everything is made of plastic so I'm not sure how long it will last. Wheels are a bit small so if you are "off the sidewalk" and edging around trees and flower beds it pulls better than it pushes. Overall, I am very please at this time and can recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: RML

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Wow why did I wait so long to buy this?! This thing has power, I had almost 2 years of overgrown grass that i had been trying to use a trimmer on for months, wasting so much time. I have Florida crabgrass that ia tough and this edger cut right through. Took a couple times to get everything 100% and a little strength to guide it, but it looks amazing now! Next time will be way faster. Assembly was super easy too, just 2 quick screws. No issues with the blade at all. Before and after pics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Design  flaw
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Black Decker electric edger. First time I tried to use it about 3 feet into edging blade came lose so I had to stop and tighten it. It continued to happen every three feet. Clearly there is a design issue if vibration loosens the blade. Contacted Customer service hoping they would have a fix to send and they simply stated they never heard of this issue before and said I can return it. I would not buy it unless the company comes up with a fix.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Brad Alpert

customer_reviews.title: Works well for home use and professional results
customer_reviews.text: It take a few minutes to get used to the machine and it may take more than one edging for good results if your edges are overgrown badly. Each subsequent cut gets easier as you develop a groove. Works well for curb. One side will get closer to the curb edge than the other. You will have to see which works easier for your situation. My curbs have never looked so good! I will save on a lot of weed eater string! I constantly use two spools per edging (corner lot). At roughly $8 per spool, that adds up over the season. Should pay for itself next year.
customer_reviews.author: Liz S

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy with first time use.
customer_reviews.text: I love Worx’s products. However, the first time you use it, get ready for a fight! I totally messed up my edging with this. Now, the second time it was used was easy breezy! Have a strong handle on this light weight machine because it can get away from you and cause gorges in your lawn. If you can master, then it’s a wonderful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mayo1212

customer_reviews.title: TWICE AS GOOD
customer_reviews.text: This edger / trencher is so awesome we bought it twice! Why? Because we sold our other house and left the first one we bought for the new home owners as a gift and bought ourselves another one. There's just nothing like this baby to get the professional results you want and need to turn what you thought was a good landscaping job into an extraordinary one. Trust me, if you do nothing else but use this, you'll improve your yard ten-fold! We share our tool with our neighbors and they love it too.
customer_reviews.author: L.M.FieldsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy refurbished
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the refurbished one from amazon. Box arrived looking like it'd been through a war. Inside, there were no instructions for assembly. I went by the pictures on the box but some parts were missing. I wasn't able to finish assembly of handle without these missing parts. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: BinaryCode

customer_reviews.title: Works well, with mod
customer_reviews.text: As has been noted in previous reviews, the modification of the tail end of the guard greatly assists in the ease of use. The guard, trimmed to the same height at the front, allows the edger to move forward without dragging on a taller turf. Motor is powerful enough, assembly easy. White stripe on top of guard helps you guide the edge. Did the job for us!
customer_reviews.author: thelews

customer_reviews.title: A Powerful and Impressive Took that is Great for Burying a Small Cable
customer_reviews.text: The edger/trencher was assembled in minutes without directions, thanks to logical design. I used the WORX Edger/Trencher to dig a trench for 3/4" flex conduit for a small cable inside flex conduit. The trencher made two parallel cuts 2" apart along open ground (after some recent rain prepared the ground). I used a straight-edge shovel to pry out the earth between trencher cuts. After some tweaking of the trenches, the flex conduit lay nicely in place at about 3/4" below the surface. The WORX made my work of laying a 50' run of cable between two building a breeze compared to shovel only. Nice tool!
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh man

customer_reviews.title: loose screws
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works well and is very powerful but the first time I used it out of the box the blade mounting plate which is secured by three screws came off and stopped the blade . Two of the three screws were missing and the third was halfway out of it's screw hole. I never found the missing screws but got two from the hardware store and was able to continue the job . I will never know if it shipped with only one screw or if they were flung away .If it does this again I will be regusted .(like Popeye the Sailor )
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Electric lawn edger
customer_reviews.text: The Worx lawn edger arrived on time. It was very easy to finish attaching handle. I used it this morning and the results looked very professional. I am nearly 69 years old and a woman, so that is saying something. The one caveat would be that lining up the blade to the walkway is challenging. I would suggest a clear plexiglass see-through so one can actually see how it is lining up. This is so much easier to use than the twine trimmer. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Burch

customer_reviews.title: The back of the shield is too low and drags on thick grass
customer_reviews.text: I've never used an edger on my lawn before and it is thick. Today is the second time I've used it and I still would go a foot or two and it would get caught. I thought it was because it was clogged with dirt or grass, but it is actually the shield. The back wheels should be higher or the shield at least 1" higher. I don't keep my grass high, I mow on the highest level in the summer when you are supposed to. I'm going to probably take a hacksaw to try and cut off that part as a suggestion from my neighbor because he thought the same thing. Other wise I really cannot use it.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Gread Edger
customer_reviews.text: I was soooo tired of messing with the gas trimmers, thought I would try this out and it works great! Edges the yard really good and I have a lot of edging to do having a corner lot on a cul-de-sac. Having to use a cord is about the only drawback and you do have to be careful not to let the blades hit the concrete too much, as they're expensive to replace.
customer_reviews.author: jibs123

customer_reviews.title: Pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes. The edger is well designed and easy to use. Assembly required some thinking but once perceived, the beauty of the design was revealed. My home is 4 years old and the lawn never edged. I edged the driveway and sidewalk in no time. The tool requires an easy learning curve, but I zoomed along the drive and sidewalk. It was so easy I assumed there would not be much to clean up. But the tool cut through 4 years of growth like a hot knife through butter. Filled about a third of an oversized leaf bag. Amazing product and a pleasure to use!!
customer_reviews.author: Dad of many kids

customer_reviews.title: Edges perfectly
customer_reviews.text: When I was growing up my dad used a gas powered edger with a blade to edge. I moved to the Midwest and everyone uses weed wackers turned on their side to edge, ineffective, annoying and costly for the stupid wire. I found this one and decided I would give it a try and it works like I remember growing up. I have a flagstone patio in back so it’s pretty uneven but this still does a good job. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Robichaud

customer_reviews.title: Reliability
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a Worx leaf blower 2 years ago and are extremely satisfied with it. Because of our experience with the Worx leaf blower we replaced our Black and Decker edger with a Worx edger. After using the edger only twice the shaft broke and the blade could not be tightened. We returned the product and recently received a replacement Worx edger. We hope this one will prove to be reliable and trouble free like our previous Black and Decker edger which lasted for more than 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, easy to use edger/cutter
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Excellent tool. I used it to cut through St. Augustine grass to put in a walkway and it cut a nice line exactly where I was aiming. Easy to handle yet powerful. Although I did not use it in this manner, it has a very simple lever mechanism to drop a metal guard for trimming along sidewalks. Nice touch as that protects the blade from damage by the sidewalk. I was very pleased with this product and would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfwriter

customer_reviews.title: Best for Heavier Jobs
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this edger for those who need heavier duty edging along straight paving and trenching. The minimum depth is 1" and the edge guide needs to be deeper to be effective. It doesn't edge along plastic lawn edging, curves or retaining walls, which are my main needs. The minimum cutting distance from a wall is 2". It certainly has the power and the blade is very strong. I'm going to look for one that isn't also a trencher and with a shallower depth option.
customer_reviews.author: Elaran

customer_reviews.title: WORKED FINE FOR ABOUT 3 YARDS
customer_reviews.text: It worked for about 3 yards, i will run, the blade will spin but the minute it touches the grass the blade stops spinning. I. The manual there isnr a trouble shooting area. Now what? Update: I figured it out, the screw that holds the blade on loosens as your edging, i had to keep poliers in my back pocket so i could tighten it every few yards. A real inconvenience, there may be a simple fix to it but i dont know what it'd be. Other than that i love it.
customer_reviews.author: Shari armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Impressive edger
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old Craftsmen edger I had used for the last 10 years that finally died. The power and trenching of this Worx Edger blows away the Craftsman. There is no comparison as the Worx unit works well with lots of power. Highly recommended. Would be nice if you could order the replacement blades directly from Amazon, but you have to order from Worx directly. Other than that, this unit is a good value for the $$.
customer_reviews.author: SteelMan89

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, easy to use. Beautiful lawn.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have never used an edger. So this review is not comparing a gas to an electric edger. This review is to say how easy it was to assemble. And once I figured out the directions...how easy it was to use. As several reviewers said, on a newly edged lawn go slowly and move the tool back and forth. The lawn looks beautiful now that it’s edged, (it’s never been edged) , I had fun doing it, and this electric Worx edger is now my favorite tool/appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work right
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure my item was defective out of the box (box was pretty beat up when it arrived). When operating, it did not work right. Wheels didn’t engage, bottom scrapes against the ground, it’s really hard to push, constantly makes a sound like the blade is hitting metal or concrete, and makes a huge dirty mess. I had the neighbor try it out to make sure it wasn’t operator error. Compared to his 20 year old Black and Decker, this one was a total dud. Either defective or just terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amyae

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price but...
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is good for a lot of simple edging and trenching. Unfortunately, it can't be used hard. If you have to use this around stone, cement, etc, it can't take the punishment. I used it for about 30 min and the blade wore down at the axle and wouldn't engage. During that 30 min, I had to carry around a wrench to tighten it every so often as it would get loose. By the way, at this time you can't get replacement blades either...they are out of stock. Summary...if you are planning to use this in the grass/dirt, you won't be disappointed, but if you are edging something like stone, try another product.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda A. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, and decent maintenance for already edged areas
customer_reviews.text: Not as powerful as I would have liked. If your grass level is higher than the concrete edge, the guard likes to get hung up on the grass. Guard isn't adjustable. I almost want to modify it by shaving some of it off. If the soil is damp or wet, it struggles. Good for light duty, and hitting spots that have previously been edged.
customer_reviews.author: Perry B.

customer_reviews.title: Edger
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little edger. I had a Black and Decker for 25 years and it finally gave out. I pressed the button on this one for the good reviews and am not disappointed. I am older so it's a bit heavy for me but I can still maneuver it around easily. So much power! I didn't realize my old one had almost no power compared to this one. Leaves a really nice edge and a few different depths you can use.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Broman

customer_reviews.title: Worx like a beast till it falls apart DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: Worx like a beast until it falls apart Blade started to come loose after 20 minutes No problem tighten it back up 5 minutes later the screws holding the gearbox together backed out MANUFACTURERS Get som LOCTITE before you kill someone Customer remove the thee gearcase screws then reinstall with loctite If you ar missing the screws they are M5x12
customer_reviews.author: john patrick

customer_reviews.title: YES, love it's light weight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an EGO. It's electric, blah-blah-blah and it's so heavy it hurts my back. And the EGO butchers my edging but the WORX's is a dream. Really large wheels it goes on flat surfaces as well as hilly terrain. And I can SEE as I edge. It's twice as fast and now I have to figure out how to get rid of my EGO edger (what a waste of money). My only complaint is that I can't stand the orange color, yuck! Why not green, pink, purple - anything but orange.
customer_reviews.author: Paris

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this edger late in 2018 as a Christmas gift and didn't use it until today. The instructions are poorly written and very vague but we figured out the settings and began with a modest cut depth. I hadn't gone 20 feet and the motor started smoking and the blade stopped rotating. I rotated the blade by hand (unplugged) and it sounded like gravel, but I put power to it again and it started up and then smoked and froze again.
customer_reviews.author: good game, pays quickly.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on my lawn.
customer_reviews.text: I so badly wanted this edger to work, I read a whole bunch of reviews. Maybe the type of grass I have is too thick (Kentucky Blue Grass), this edger simply didn't work. If you're looking for an edger to maintain pre-cut clean lines this edger might work just fine. If, like me, you're starting from scratch (hoping to someday have clean grass lines) you'll need something with more power.
customer_reviews.author: radnad

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but good luck purchasing a new blade
customer_reviews.text: Great tool but good luck purchasing a new blade. I've been waiting for a new blade for 2 months. They keep telling each week via email it's on back order.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy one
customer_reviews.text: I own one and now it will be discarded. The blade wore out quickly and Worx does not supply replacement blades. No other site I've searched on the web has any in stock and say they do not know if they will become available again. I contacted Worx to ask and have received no reply. The blade quickly wore down to a smooth rectangle with no teeth. Therefore it will not edge or trench. Suit yourself if you buy one, just expect to discard the entire unit when the blade is shot.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Weddle

customer_reviews.title: Not sure which is worse, the waste of time or waste of money I spent on this
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Black & Decker Edger that worked decently for about 10 years before it handle broke off. I thought I there would be something better out there so I tried this device and it was a total fail. I tried calling Worx for support on their malfunctioning device and couldn't get through so instead of wasting my whole weekend I am returning this device and headed to Lowes to but another Black & Decker
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It WORX so good!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! This is my first tool made by 'WORX', and I am highly satisfied. Very easy to assemble out of the box, and easy to operate. It has a strong motor, and I was able to edge my whole driveway and the sidewalks around my house with no problem at all. I usually only buy DeWalt tools, but since Dewalt doesnt make an edger/trencher, I decided to go with WORX. And what can I say? It WORX Well!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 4th use
customer_reviews.text: At first, it worked great! But on the 4th use, something must have broken off of it because even though the but is completely tightened, the blade is very loose and it will no longer work at all as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Natassia

customer_reviews.title: Great for trenching to bury low voltage lines!
customer_reviews.text: This edger works as advertised. I dug a few trenches to bury my low voltage lines and the trenching mode worked great. Also, I have edged my corner lot twice so far with perfect results. I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great for small yards and driveways
customer_reviews.text: Used it right out of the box ( very simple to put together ) on a sidewalk and driveway that had not been edged for a couple of years. Cut thru the matted grass with no problem so further edging will be a snap! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ex A F Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Can't bet it for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've never had an edger but I can't imagine one being much better than this one. It does what it is supposed to do. I have used it four times so far and haven't had any problems. The third time I used it the blade stopped spinning but I just tightened the nut and it worked fine. Bada big bada boom. Lightweight. Easy to assemble. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad back and purchased this trimmer in hopes that I could easily use it on sidewalks, driveway and street gutters. It does a great job and does not put a strain on my back. I can push it with one hand without bending. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: WFT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: i didn't want to spend a lot of money on an edger and thought I would try this one. Absolutely worth every penny!! My driveway had not been edged for three years. This worked wonderfully. I had to go over a couple of areas a second time because of some heavy clumps of grass but now my driveway is about 3 inches wider than I thought it was. I'm sold on it!
customer_reviews.author: loveglass

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: The edger and trencher work well. Besides doing edges well. I trenched an 8x2 foot area for a raised garden bed. It worked well allowing me to remove my sod. After my first run, I did identify that the screw for the blade loosened and tightened it. Must admit I was noticing that I was getting no trim and was about to call support. I recommend this product. It is performing well.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Makes for really quick edging work
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and it sure beats edging with a trimmer/edger. I gave up edging with a trimmer, it's tedious and the results are less than clean looking. The Worx WG896 did a fantastic job. I put it together and plugged it in to test a small section to get a feel for how it worked. My wife like the results so much she said to keep going. In 30 minutes we had our entire front sidewalk done, about 120 ft. It cut through some pretty thick sod hanging over the walk. We just had to peel up the strips of sod after.
customer_reviews.author: DocBrown

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked for all of 30 minutes (that would be two 15 minute sessions, because the blade had to be tighten after the first 15 minutes), now won’t work at all. Something “inside” is “skipping” not allowing the blade to turn. POS!!! Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: amyolier

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today. Haven't edged my yard since we moved in 7 years ago. The ground is moist and it was raining. With all of those conditions, the edger still worked perfectly. What I did have to do is clear out the chamber of mud and grass every once in a while. Easy to assemble and easy to use. If it lasts then it will be a great addition to my lawn care tools
customer_reviews.author: Ray from Wash DC

customer_reviews.title: Very Under-powered
customer_reviews.text: I would never buy this item again. Motor isn't strong enough to keep the blade moving when you make contact with the ground to edge. Makes it almost impossible to make any sort of progress when working.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for the job!
customer_reviews.text: When they built our house they put dirt all the way to the top of the cement and then did the sod... this has caused a LOT of overgrowth on the the sidewalks, driveway, and curbs. I wanted a unit with a guide so chose this one. All in All I love it! I wish it had some type of marker up front so you know you are going in a straight line but I made due.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: WORX WG896 12 Amp 7.5" Electric Lawn Edger & Trencher, 7.5in, Orange and Black
customer_reviews.text: Just got my Worx edger. The bolts that hold the handle on are not matched and I need one that is on the left in the photo. The square one will not go in the round hole. I would contact the parts folks but have no email or phone #.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: This edger easily handled a sidewalk and driveway which had not been edged for several years. I haven't tried wire trenching with it, but it has the power and depth adjustments to cut through my turf easily enough. Operation is intuitive, but make sure you use the correct extension cord; minimum 14 gauge (12 gauge is better) outdoor rated cord for 100 feet, and plug it into a dedicated 15 amp (20 amp is better) socket. It cleans up easily and hangs up on my wall, out of the way, when not in use. I appreciate well-designed and well-made tools; this is one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you like garbage, you should buy this item!
customer_reviews.text: Broke on its first use. This product is garbage. Garbage! Gaaaaaahbadge! Worked fine for about 8 minutes and then the bolt that secures the edger guard snapped which must of destroyed something else because the item refused to edge after that. Started to emit a heavy burning smell. So yeah, I'm definitely returning this, not gonna clean it up either. Gonna send it back how it is.
customer_reviews.author: matthew Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Great edger. Versatile tool: edging & trenching.
customer_reviews.text: Love the edger. Haven't edged for years. Some places grass had grown 6" into street. First time edging took a little longer, because I had to go over overgrown parts several times. Never bogged down, just a little back and forth nudging got through it. Now I edge whole yard in a few minutes. I've also used it to trench around bad patches in lawn so I could sod them. Love it. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nope, not today.
customer_reviews.text: We never got to use this product. When we opened the box the power cord on one side was severed completely. One side (pictured) is intact while the other side of the cord (coming out of the handle) was severed. We ordered another one so I guess we will see. Meantime our lawn just grows and grows!!
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: powerful yet easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: 1st time in 30 years this property has had the grass edged. Due to the overgrown edges I had to go over some spots a second time. An area with a "new" sidewalk ( 4 years old) had this tool cut straight and even without any problems. This item will add a great look to your grass edges and should grace the tool hanger in your garage.
customer_reviews.author: mcdtc

customer_reviews.title: Great service
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these and it was defective at first use. When i decided to return it, i had the option of returning and getting another with no charge as long as I returned in 30 days. Since it was easy to put together and light weight, I decided to try it again. The second one worked great. I buried 500 feet of in ground dog fencing in one day. I appreciate the great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Beccapril108

customer_reviews.title: Works fine after the first edging.
customer_reviews.text: If you are edging your lawn for the first time, be prepared to destroy the blade and also put some sweat into your edging. However, once you sharpen the blade back up and trim your lawn regularly, this edger works great. One thing I wish that they could improve on is the blade. It either needs a sharper edge or it needs to be sharpened on a different angle. It tends to tear the grass blades instead of cutting them clean across and the blade seems a bit thick to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement blades not available
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for a total of one hour, before the cutting part of the blade was worn away. Part of this was my fault as I was using it in the "trench" mode along a sidewalk, instead of the edger mode, so I don't necessarily blame the tool for that. What irritates me is that there are no more blades available. Worx says they are out, and you can sign up to get an email when they have replacement blades, which I did. Months ago. The fact that I haven't heard from Worx indicates that there are many, many people in the same boat.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Scala

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but not as strong as needed
customer_reviews.text: The thing definitely cuts but I've had to "bring it down" on the part of the lawn I needed to be edge-trimmed. Sometimes I have to lift it up to let the blade start spinning before bringing it down on top of some heavy roots/grass. I was hoping for something easy to use but it took me 3 hours over the span of two days to get some really overgrown edges trimmed.
customer_reviews.author: Draining Sink

customer_reviews.title: Professional Results!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband, and he loves this edger. It took a couple of minutes to get the hang of it, but pretty simple to figure out. Our yard was completely transformed. It did take a couple of passes, but that’s because our lawn edges were very overgrown! Great product, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Stueve

customer_reviews.title: Melted the extension cord
customer_reviews.text: Table 1 in the user manual indicates 14 gauge is fine at 10-12 amps at 100ft. But then in the same table is shows 12-16 at 100ft is not recommended. Given I used a 14 gauge 100ft cord and it melted the reciptical I'm guessing using a 100ft cord is in the not recommended category for this 12 amp edger. Other than that it works fine
customer_reviews.author: Handy Guy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SO FAR
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today & it worked like a charm. I hadn't edged for quite awhile as my string edger didn't do much of a job & this one reallycleaned up the edges of my lawn. The reviews said the blades were hard to get, so I ordered an extra blade & had in 2 days, no problem. If any problems in the future will edit this review, but for starters 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: DRB

customer_reviews.title: Works great and fast
customer_reviews.text: This product is great and easy to use. The guide will keep you on track with no scraping of the pavement. The only downfall is the guards make it hard to get over high points and the blade is fixed so any low points will be hard to get.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Tighten bolt holding blade in place before beginning
customer_reviews.text: Ok... tried this edger out this weekend snd it worked great! My yard had never been edged so it was pretty slow going but the edger performed great. Plenty of power, comfortable handle/ grip. I would suggest tightening the nut holding blade in place before you begin. I didnt do this and after edging about 10’ of lawn the blade would barely spin even though the motor was running full out. I tightened down that nut holding the blade and it worked like a charm for the next 400’ of lawn edging! I highly recommend this edger.... this is 100% my honest opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Randy J

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in February 2019 and it stopped working this spring 2020. Even though I registered my product and placed a warranty claim in May 2020, the company "conveniently" lost my registration, lost my initial claim for replacement and weeks went by with no replacement product in hand. I finally got a hold of a customer service rep in July, placed the warranty order again, paid for shipping $12 (no big deal), but now its back ordered so I have to wait longer (6-8 weeks) after I was originally told 2-3 weeks. I officially hate this company. Don't buy their cheap crap and deal with their nonexistent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: B. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Can be hard to handle
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time as described. Is lightweight but bucks a lot which forces you to pull back then move forward again. Does the job. Remember the blade sounds backwards as all these types do. Being inexperienced with this tow I found that the reverse spinning to be strange. One would think it would spin forward. What do I know.
customer_reviews.author: Gripper

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, we've only used this three times so far, but I really like it. It has great power and only bogs down on the really thick stuff. I was hesitant to buy a WORX product. (I have always been pretty brand loyal) It does it's job and I would recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: CNGAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After Less Then A Year Of Use
customer_reviews.text: Suddenly stopped working less then a year after I purchased it. Cannot find any technical support for this item on their website or through a Google search. Guess I will trash it and buy a different one. Gets 2 stars because when it was working it did a decent job.
customer_reviews.author: mauihanle

customer_reviews.title: It is not as easy to use as the gas powered
customer_reviews.text: I went from a gas powered edger to this electric unit. It is not as easy to use as the gas powered. It's difficult to determine where the edge of the concrete is? It has enough power to edge but it's not always in the correct spot! To replace my gas powered unit would be over $300. And I always had a problem starting the gas unit. This unit will always work as long I have electric power.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Molter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Edger
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a string trimmer with edger attachment. This does a wonderful job even though I have to use 150 feet of cord to reach sections of my yard. I can finish with less strain on my back from carrying the old edger, in fact I usually finish quicker than I could start the balky gas engine on the TroyBilt. It'd also nice and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Spekcity

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was not sure due to the low price but this edger is all it's cracked up to be. Just used it on about 100 feet of sidewalk it worked great. It churned out mud and grass like a champ with enough power. It never stalled but I did have to clean out around the blade a number of times due to buildup but that didn't stop it from running at all. Glad I got this one and would buy it again. Easy cleanup, I'm sure the next time will be easier due to having a groove to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like a champ. My yard hadn’t been edged in years so the first time took quite a while. I would go about 6 inches, then move back and have to dig the grass and dirt out in order to continue. However, after the first edging, it zips through with no problems and make my front yard look great. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: K Tippett

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother. I’m not sure this thing will even cut warm butter. After reading the reviews, and not wanting to buy a gas powered tool - I’d give this a try. If your yard is already perfect, and need a tool for very light touch up, go for it. If in the other hand you’ve left this awful job for a year or more - do it by hand. I did - all 460’ of it
customer_reviews.author: Jake M.

customer_reviews.title: Effective edger and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well and better than expected. Previously, I had tried a line trimmer and also a gas powered edger, and found this to be easier to use than the gas trimmer and created a much nicer edge than the line trimmer. It had plenty of power for edging along the concrete and into dry clay soil, I only wish I had tried this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Z

customer_reviews.title: Worx great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was an easy setup and easy to use once you're familiar with using the guide to track along the cutting edge. Plenty of power and leave a much better edge than a string trimmer could. Start with shallow depth cuts and get progressively deeper in subsequent uses.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Almarez

customer_reviews.title: Works outstanding for me
customer_reviews.text: I read the previous reviews and found them very helpful. That also included the negative ones. I did check the blade nut to ensure it was tight. It was. I had to go though a few heavy areas for my edging. I just took my time and it worked great. I would recommend this product .
customer_reviews.author: coastie9

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Purchase
customer_reviews.text: When purchasing I thought this product was going to change my lawn...it does not...it’s so hard to use...I had to buy a different edger. It does not cut properly and it very hard to line up the edge. I would return but I trashed the box...Do no purchase...it’s a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany B

customer_reviews.title: The trimmer they have that is battery powered SUCKS for edging
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I am able to edge the lawn and the grass that grows in the cracks of the driveway. The only negative is that you have to be plugged in. I wish they made and edger that was battery powered. The trimmer they have that is battery powered SUCKS for edging.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lopez

product_meta.title: WORX WG896 12 Amp 7.5" Electric Lawn Edger & Trencher, 7.5in, Orange and Black
product_meta.description: Style:12 Amp 7.5" Electric Lawn Edger & TrencherWhen you need to really give some definition to your lawn elements, or to bury wire, the WORX 12 Amp Electric 7.5” Lawn Edger/Trencher will do the job. Powerful, yet easy to use, it only weighs 14 lbs so you can easily push it along. Cleaning out clogs and replacing the blade is also easy, just make sure you always unplug it first. The blade itself is quite a tool, made of heavy-duty steel with serrated edges, it makes for clean, straight lines, and has a wear indicator that shows when it needs to be replaced. It’s easy to assemble once you get it, so you’ll be out making your lawn and garden beautiful and more defined in no time.
feature_bullets: Power like the pros: The 12 Amp motor spins the 7.5” blade fast and deep at 4700 revolutions per minute, giving you professional; looking lines and edges
3 depth adjustments: Cut down at 1”, 1-1/4”, 1-1/2” depending on the task at hand
Cutting line indicator: Stay on the straight and narrow with the cutting line guide you’ll notice a difference when you’re done
Adjustable shaft: Users of any height can find a length and comfortable position that works for them with the adjustable shaft and D grip handle
Adjustable handle: The handle pivots for maximum comfort and control

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,067 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
